UPNW Train #626 Originated at Barrington
Train #626, scheduled to arrive Chicago at 8:11 a.m., has originated at Barrington and will make all station stops to Chicago.

UPW - Geneva Station Is ADA Inaccessible
The Geneva station is currently ADA inaccessible. Passengers should utilize La Fox or West Chicago as an alternative. Updates will be provided.

UPNW Train #613 Will Not Operate
Train #613, scheduled to depart Chicago at 7:00 a.m., will not operate.  Train #615 and #617 will accommodate passengers.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/MD-N?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Inbound Trains Remain Stopped

Inbound trains are stopped near Prairie Crossing and Grayslake due to positive train control dispatching system issues on the Canadian National. Inbound and outbound trains may be extensively delayed.  Updated 7:00 a.m.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/UP-NW?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
UPNW Inbound and Outbound Trains Stopped Near Pingree

Union Pacific Northwest Line Inbound and outbound trains are stopped near Pingree due to signal problems. The estimated time of delays are unknown.  We will update this information as soon as it becomes available.  Updated at 6:14 a.m.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/MD-N?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
MDN Train #2101, Terminating at Libertyville
Train #2101, scheduled to arrive Lake Forest at 7:29 a.m., is terminating at Libertyville.  Train #2105, scheduled to depart Chicago at 7:05 a.m., will accommodate passengers.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/HC?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
HCD #914 Will Not Operate

Train #914, scheduled to depart Joliet at 5:45 a.m., will not operate due to positive train control issues.  Train #916, will accommodate passengers.  This train is a delayed departure.  We will update this information as soon as it becomes available.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/MD-W?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
MDW 2203 Delayed
Train #2203, scheduled to arrive Big Timber Road/Elgin at 7:48 AM is operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule due to a mechanical failure on train 2201.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/NCS?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
NCS Inbound Trains Departing Antioch Delayed Departure Due to Positive Train Control Issues

Trains departing from Antioch will be a delayed departure due to positive train control dispatching issues on the Canadian National.  Inbound and outbound trains may be extensively delayed.  Metra will update you as information becomes available.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/UP-NW?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
UPNW Train #605 Terminating at Barrington

Train #605, will terminate at Barrington. This train is on the move and may be operating 35 minutes behind schedule. Train #611, scheduled to depart Harvard at 8:25 a.m., will accommodate passengers.  This train may be operating 25 minutes behind schedule.

The Van Buren Street Station elevator is out of service. Customers can use South Water or Museum Campus as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

MDW Major Service Disruption

Inbound and outbound trains may be operating with extensive delays due positive train control dispatching system issues. Some trains may be departing late, operating out of sequence or annulled. Please visit metra.com for current delay information.

Train #2222, scheduled to depart Big Timber at 7:20 a.m., will not operate due to mechanical problems.  Train #2226, will make all station stops to Chicago to accommodate passengers.

UPNW Train #612 and #614 Terminating at Crystal Lake
Train #612 and #614 terminating at Crystal Lake.  These trains will operate as extra outbound trains to accommodate passengers from Crystal Lake to Harvard.

MDW Train #2201 Will Not Operate Past Galewood.

Train 2201, scheduled to arrive Big Timber Road/Elgin at 7:08 AM, will not operate past Galewood due to mechanical failure.  Train #2203, scheduled to arrive Big Timber at 7:48 a.m., will accommodate passengers.  Updated at 6:51 a.m.

HCD Inbound Trains Departing Joliet Delayed Departure Due to Positive Train Control Issues

HCD trains departing from Joliet will be a delayed departure due to positive train control dispatching issues on the Canadian National. Inbound and outbound trains may be extensively delayed. Metra will update you as information becomes available.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-W -  Geneva Platform 2 Rehabilitation

On Monday, October 9, the Geneva outbound platform (Platform 2) will be closed for rehabilitation through the end of 2024. Commuters must use the temporary platform located east of Third Street. All trains will board passengers from the rear cars on this platform. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  147th St./Sibley Blvd station closed for reconstruction until fall 2024.

The 147th street/Sibley Blvd station is closed for reconstruction until fall 2024. During this time, trains will not stop at this station. As alternates, please use the nearby Ivanhoe or Harvey stations. Updates will be provided once  the rehabilitation is complete and the station is accessible. Metra apologizes for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Millennium Station elevator out of service until further notice
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service until further notice.  Customers can use the elevator located at 205 N Michigan, which leads to the South Water entrance to Millennium Station
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-W - River Forest Platform 2 Rehabilitation

Beginning Wednesday, May 8, the east half of Platform 2 (island platform) will be closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will move to the west half of Platform 2 to complete the project by the end of November.

Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-N - Track Construction Tuesday, September 24 through Thursday, October 3.

From Tuesday, September. 24 through Thursday, October 3, track construction will take place on the UP North Line between Glencoe and Highland Park. Some midday and evening trains may incur delays of up to 30 minutes enroute passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. Residents near the tracks can expect construction noise as the project moves through their area. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert BNSF - Tracks #2, and #4, out of service at Chicago Union Station.

Tracks #2, and #4, are out of service on the south concourse at Chicago Union Station until further notice due to the Canal St., construction project. BNSF, Southwest Service, and Heritage Corridor passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need help, please contact Metra personnel for assistance.

Metra Alert HC - Metra to offer Saturday "Rails, Trails and Ales" Excursions on the Heritage Corridor Beginning September 7

Metra will once again be offering special service on the Heritage Corridor Line on six Saturdays this fall, providing opportunities to explore the bike trails, festivals, craft breweries, restaurants, and vibrant communities along this historic route. Full schedules can be found on metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Chicago Bears Games
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for the Chicago Bears home games. For more information click here and visit metra.com.
